intro: Lachemilla talamanquensis, commonly known as the Talamanca stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the cloud forests of central Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its compact rosettes of fleshy, silver-gray leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
